subject: History
title: The United Nations Is Born
description: A micro-lesson that makes The United Nations Is Born usable.

hook.text: After two world wars killed 100 million people, 51 nations agreed: there has to be a better way.

buildup.text: The League of Nations, created after WWI, had failed to prevent aggression. It had no army and no teeth.

discovery.text: In 1945, the UN was founded with a Security Council that could authorize military forceâ€”real power this time.

twist.text: The five permanent members (US, UK, France, Russia, China) each got veto powerâ€”making consensus nearly impossible.

climax.text: The UN hasn't prevented all wars, but it has provided a forum for dialogue and deployed peacekeepers to 70+ conflicts.

punchline.text: An imperfect institution built on one lesson: never again.

quiz.question: What gave the United Nations more power than the League of Nations?
options: It had a larger budget for humanitarian aid
Its Security Council could authorize military force
Every nation was required to join by international law
